senses.ex: Can you please pick up those books from the floor?

Tips.title: Physical Action
Tips.description: Used when talking about a physical act involving hands or arms.
Tips.example: Pick up your toys before bedtime.

Tips.title: Helping Others
Tips.description: Often used to suggest helping by holding or carrying something for someone.
Tips.example: Can you pick up these bags for me?

senses.de: To learn new skill or knowledge
senses.ex: She picked up French during her stay in Paris.

Tips.title: Passive Learning
Tips.description: Describes learning that happens casually and without formal study.
Tips.example: He picked up some Italian by listening to songs.

Tips.title: Subconscious Process
Tips.description: Can indicate learning without realizing it at the time.
Tips.example: Kids can pick up bad habits easily.

senses.ex: Business has picked up since the new manager started.

Tips.title: Change Over Time
Tips.description: Suggests a gradual improvement or increase over a period.
Tips.example: The wind is picking up; take a jacket.

Tips.title: Temporary Decline
Tips.description: Used when after a decline things start to get better.
Tips.example: Sales are slow now but should pick up soon.

senses.de: To collect someone from a certain place
senses.ex: I'll pick you up at 5 from the train station.

Tips.title: Scheduled Arrival
Tips.description: Used when arranging a specific time and place to get someone.
Tips.example: I'll pick you up after your meeting ends.

Tips.title: Reliability
Tips.description: Shows promise of punctuality and presence for someone waiting.
Tips.example: Don't worry, I will always pick you up on time.

senses.ex: I'll pick up some milk on the way home.

Tips.title: Along the Way
Tips.description: Indicates buying something while already on a trip or outing.
Tips.example: Could you pick up some bread while you're out?

Tips.title: Casual Purchase
Tips.description: Used when the purchase is unplanned or not the main purpose of a trip.
Tips.example: I picked up a few snacks at the gas station.

senses.de: To start a casual relationship with someone
senses.ex: He tried to pick up a girl at the club.

Tips.title: Social Context
Tips.description: Often said about meeting someone with a romantic intent in a social setting.
Tips.example: He's going to the party to try and pick up.

Tips.title: Slight Suggestiveness
Tips.description: Can imply a less serious, more casual intention than formal dating.
Tips.example: People often go to bars to pick up dates.
